title: V60 NEXUS DIVINE AppV1.jsx full overwrite + compile-safe wiring (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Full overwrite frontend/src/AppV1.jsx with the user-provided V60 “NEXUS DIVINE” code block verbatim as the complete local-only UI and logic.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` is a full-file overwrite containing exactly the user-provided V60 code (no refactors, no feature additions).

The V60 flows exist as coded: Intro screen (PURE BEAUTY) → App feed with categories → selecting a salon opens the morphing detail overlay via `layoutId` → selecting services toggles the gold glow state → the final Champagne Gold CTA appears when at least one service is selected.

file_operations.description: Delete all existing contents and replace the entire file with the exact V60 “NEXUS DIVINE” code block from user message `user-msg-v60` (verbatim, including imports, `CATEGORIES`/`SALONS`, `serifFont`, Framer Motion `layoutId` morphing, Liquid Gold selection effect, and final Champagne Gold CTA).

requirements.summary: Ensure the app compiles and runs after the V60 overwrite using only minimal mechanical fixes that do not change V60 UI/UX, copy, or behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or equivalent CI build) succeeds with the V60 `AppV1.jsx` in place.
The app boots through the existing Vite/React entry wiring and renders the V60 Intro as the initial view.
Any changes made beyond the AppV1 overwrite are strictly limited to build-breaking mechanical fixes and do not alter visible UI/UX or text.

file_operations.description: If (and only if) the repository build fails after the verbatim V60 overwrite, apply the smallest possible mechanical adjustments inside this file strictly to resolve build-breaking issues (e.g., missing/incorrect imports, undefined identifiers, invalid JSX, conflicting exports) while preserving the V60 layout, styling (Tailwind classes), copy, in-file datasets, and interaction behavior exactly as intended.

Add minimal TypeScript module declarations only if the build toolchain fails due to missing type declarations for libraries used by the V60 code (keep declarations minimal and non-invasive to avoid changing runtime behavior).

requirements.summary: Keep frontend/src/App.tsx as the thin wrapper rendering AppV1 and do not modify immutable entry wiring; app continues to mount via frontend/src/main.tsx.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` continues to only render `<AppV1 />` (no routing or provider changes added there).
No changes are made to immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

file_operations.description: Add a small internal check note documenting the wrapper contract: `App.tsx` must remain a thin renderer of `AppV1`, and mounting must remain through `main.tsx`. This exists to prevent accidental future edits; no entry files are modified.
